bestBHT.bht: In an undisclosed time and place, Jesus was diligently teaching, utilizing every opportunity to instruct people in the Gospel. One of these occasions took place in a synagogue, likely in Perea, on the sacred Sabbath day. Though the exact details of the event's timing and location may be indefinite, this episode serves as a testament to Jesus' commitment to spreading his teachings across various settings, such as the countless synagogues in Jerusalem.

John Calvin: I have resolved to place in immediate connection some events which are detailed by Luke alone, without a direct reference to dates.
For on that point, as we have formerly mentioned, the Evangelists did not care much about exactness.
We shall afterward find a more suitable time for returning to the Harmony of the Three Evangelists.
Philip Schaff: Luke 13:10. In one of the synagogues. In Perea, as we suppose.
On the sabbath day. This is the main point, whenever and wherever the incident occurred.
Archibald T. Robertson: He was teaching (ην διδασκων). Periphrastic imperfect active.
John Gill: Jesus... took all opportunities of instructing men in the truths of the Gospel."
In Jerusalem... there were three hundred and ninety-four synagogues; and other writers increase their number, and say, there were four hundred and eighty.
It was on the sabbath; which was now in force, and was religiously observed by Christ.

bhtAttempts.bht: In an undisclosed time and place, Jesus was teaching, taking advantage of every opportunity to instruct people in the truths of the Gospel. One of these occasions was in a synagogue, most likely in Perea. The significance of this event lies in the fact that it happened on the Sabbath day, a moment of religious devotion and observance. While the exactness of the event's timing and location may not be of utmost importance to the Gospel writers, it underscores the fact that Jesus utilized various settings, such as the countless synagogues in Jerusalem, to deliver his teachings with the utmost diligence.
